instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Retro-Futurism' aesthetic: Dark backgrounds, sharp borders, monospace headings.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all headings and code-related text. Use 'IBM Plex Sans' for body text.
The primary color is Electric Green (#22C55E). Use it for success states, active borders, and primary actions.
Avoid rounded corners larger than 'rounded-sm' (2px-4px). Keep the UI sharp and technical.
Use the 'Control Room' grid layout for the dashboard: dense, data-heavy, with visible borders between sections.
Ensure all interactive elements have a distinct hover state (e.g., border color change or subtle background shift).
Use the provided image URLs for the login background and hero sections.
Do not use gradients for backgrounds unless it's a very subtle glow. Prefer solid colors or grid patterns.
For the Markdown editor, ensure it feels like a code editor: dark theme, syntax highlighting colors matching the palette.
Respect the 'data-testid' requirement for all interactive elements.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly, mainly for overlays.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped (or sharp for this specific design) with interaction animations.
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, entrance animations.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
